name: plugout_tt
author: AFNI Developers
description: This program connects to AFNI and receives notification whenever the user changes Talairach coordinates.

inputs.description: Name of the host computer to connect to AFNI on. The default is to connect on the current host using shared memory.
inputs.name: Host Name

inputs.description: Get voxel indices from AFNI instead of Talairach coordinates.
inputs.name: IJK Option

inputs.description: Enable verbose mode (prints lots of diagnostic messages).
inputs.name: Verbose Flag

inputs.description: TCP/IP port number to use. The default is 8001.
inputs.name: Port Number

inputs.description: String to use as the name that AFNI assigns to this plugout. The default is something silly.
inputs.name: Plugin Name

inputs.description: Provide a port offset to allow multiple instances of communicating programs to operate on the same computer. Use an integer in the inclusive range [1025 to 65500].
inputs.name: Port Offset

inputs.description: Provide a port offset to allow multiple instances of communicating programs to operate on the same computer with quiet output in case of issues. Use an integer in the inclusive range [1025 to 65500].
inputs.name: Port Offset Quiet

inputs.description: Provide a port offset bloc for easier configuration of multiple instances. PORT_OFFSET_BLOC is an integer between 0 and MAX_BLOC (around 4000).
inputs.name: Port Bloc

inputs.description: Print the current value of MAX_BLOC and exit. Stay under 2000 for safety.
inputs.name: Max Port Bloc

inputs.description: Print the current value of MAX_BLOC quietly and exit.
inputs.name: Max Port Bloc Quiet

inputs.description: Print the number of assigned ports used by AFNI, then quit.
inputs.name: Number of Assigned Ports

inputs.description: Print the number of assigned ports used by AFNI quietly, then quit.
inputs.name: Number of Assigned Ports Quiet
